verses.text: \sc And\sc* the \sc Lord\sc* called unto Moses, and spake unto him out of the tabernacle of the congregation, saying,

Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, If \add any\add* man of you bring an offering unto the \sc Lord\sc*, ye shall bring your offering of the cattle, \add even\add* of the herd, and of the flock.

If his offering \add be\add* a burnt sacrifice of the herd, let him offer a male without blemish: he shall offer it of his own voluntary will at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the \sc Lord\sc*.
And he shall put his hand upon the head of the burnt offering; and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.

And he shall kill the bullock before the \sc Lord\sc*: and the priests, Aaron’s sons, shall bring the blood, and sprinkle the blood round about upon the altar that \add is by\add* the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And he shall flay the burnt offering, and cut it into his pieces.
And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar, and lay the wood in order upon the fire:
and the priests, Aaron’s sons, shall lay the parts, the head, and the fat, in order upon the wood that \add is\add* on the fire which \add is\add* upon the altar:
but his inwards and his legs shall he wash in water: and the priest shall burn all on the altar, \add to be\add* a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
And if his offering \add be\add* of the flocks, \add namely\add*, of the sheep, or of the goats, for a burnt sacrifice; he shall bring it a male without blemish.
And he shall kill it on the side of the altar northward before the \sc Lord\sc*: and the priests, Aaron’s sons, shall sprinkle his blood round about upon the altar.
And he shall cut it into his pieces, with his head and his fat: and the priest shall lay them in order on the wood that \add is\add* on the fire which \add is\add* upon the altar:

but he shall wash the inwards and the legs with water: and the priest shall bring \add it\add* all, and burn \add it\add* upon the altar: it \add is\add* a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
And if the burnt sacrifice for his offering to the \sc Lord\sc* \add be\add* of fowls, then he shall bring his offering of turtledoves, or of young pigeons.
And the priest shall bring it unto the altar, and wring off his head, and burn \add it\add* on the altar; and the blood thereof shall be wrung out at the side of the altar:
and he shall pluck away his crop with his feathers, and cast it beside the altar on the east part, by the place of the ashes:

and he shall cleave it with the wings thereof, \add but\add* shall not divide \add it\add* asunder: and the priest shall burn it upon the altar, upon the wood that \add is\add* upon the fire: it \add is\add* a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
